result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas H Gauger Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas H Gauger Jr

records.addlTxt:
9:32 a.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Thomas Roley.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.
COURT ORDERS: $50.00 fine; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. Defendant to make payment plan with COC. 

Adj: 9:43 a.m.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Attorney Roley appears in person; Defendant appears in person
DATES: 
Keep on - will be a plea

Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury Trial on January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.M.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence - Wausau P.D.

Clerk Micki. 
Case called: 2:42p.m.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence for ADA Hannah Boeck.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
No contact with victim(s): J.M.L.
Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence - Wausau PD. 

Dates:
PTC: 8/4/22 at 9:20a.m. 
JPTC: 8/25/22 at 9:20a.m.
JSH: 12/19/22 at 9:20a.m.
JT: 1/18/23 at 9:00a.m.

ADJ: 2:46p.m.
